column4: sorry didn't follow from the beginning... what is the problem exactly ? you have a 32 bits package that you want to install on a 64 bits system ?

yes.. its my mx340 drivers.. i used to do dpkg --force-all -i with ia32libs installed and everything would work great for the past 3 releases.. now it breaks my package install whenever i set them up that way.. even though they function..  I also have the source but have no idea how to compile
isn't there a README or INSTALL file in the source package ? could you post a link to that source package ?
nope... thats what bugs me... http://support-au.canon.com.au/P/search?model=PIXMA+MX340&menu=download&filter=0&tagname=g_os&g_os=Linux
having a look, give me a few minutes
sur
sur
sure*
btw, before trying to compile, did you try --force-architecture instead of --force-all ?
will try
it still asks for install -f
first purge the package, then run "sudo apt-get install -f" then dpkg --force-architecture
did it
did that
ok then i'll have a look at the source
all you should have to do to compile is extract the tarball then cd to the created folder and run "make" then "sudo make install"
glebihan.. normally yes.. but it doesnt
meaning ? what errors do you get ?
error all ** stop
